remarks.para: One per axis may be inoperative provided the associated valve position is verified open before each departure.

placard.para: Placard on affected switch(es): "S/O LIGHT INOP". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: The FLT CONTROL HYD POWER switches are located on the overhead maintenance panel. This MMEL item allows dispatch with up to 2 VALVE CLOSED lights inoperative. “One per axis” means that only 1 in the upper row (TAIL) and 1 in the lower row (WING) may be inoperative. Use the following procedure to verify that the associated flight control hydraulic valve(s) is open before dispatch.

numlitem.para: Check the position of the associated valve(s).
Make sure the applicable FLT CONTROL HYD POWER switch(es) on the P461 Pilot’s Overhead Maintenance Panel are in the NORM position.
For the applicable system, make sure the following circuit breakers are closed on the P180 DC Power Distribution Panel:
Gain access to the associated valve(s).
If shutoff valve is WING system 1, remove outboard aileron access panel 591BB on left wing to access the aileron/spoiler shutoff valve.
If shutoff valve is WING system 4, remove outboard aileron access panel 691BB on right wing to access the aileron/spoiler shutoff valve.
If shutoff valve is WING system 2 or 3, the associated aileron/spoiler shutoff valve is located at the rear spar through the opening of the left or right wing gear wheel well.

If the shutoff valve is TAIL 1, 2, 3, or 4, open access door 312A (Horizontal Stabilizer Jackscrew Access Door) to gain access to the area aft of the pressure bulkhead where the associated elevator/rudder shutoff valves are located.
Verify that the visual indicator lever on the associated shutoff valve motor is in the valve open position (POS 2).
Close the access door or panel and remove electrical power.
